message.content:
{"id": "5473", 
"title": "Bug 5473: ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces", 
"description": "Bug 5473: ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces. Build 200110251.", 
"OB": "When executing ShiftLeft on a line with intermixed tabs and spaces, the text does not move as expected.", 
"EB": "After executing ShiftLeft on a line with intermixed tabs and spaces, the text should be shifted left. Any leading tabs should be replaced with spaces so that the lines are visually indented the same. In the first scenario, the second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted at least to the first space character, effectively getting rid of the tab. It should be ensured that there are no stray spaces, as this can be confusing and prevent the text from shifting.", 
"SR": "To reproduce the issue in a default text editor, follow these steps:\n1. Type the following lines:\na. \<space\>\<tab\>some text\nb. \<tab\>some text2\n2. Highlight the two lines and execute ShiftLeft.\n3. Notice that nothing moves when it should have shifted left."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '5473', 'title': 'Bug 5473ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces', 'description': 'Bug 5473ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': "Replace the tab character in the first line with spaces so that the twolines are indented the same visually.Execute ShiftLeft.The text now moves.I'm not sure how this is spec'd, but in the first scenario it seems like thesecond line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left atleast to the space character (i.e., get rid of the tab).At any rate, it'sdefinitely confusing if there is a stray space.You don't know why the textwon't shift. ", 'SR': 'In a default text editor type in the following:<space<tabsome text<tabsome text2. Now highlight the two lines above and execute ShiftLeft.Notice thatnothing moves.3. '}
